definition[0]: to try to persuade someone to do something by making it seem attractive
example[0]: The new program is designed to tempt young people into studying engineering.
example[1]: It would take a lot of money to tempt me to quit this job.
definition[1]: to make someone want to have or do something, even though they know they really should not
example[2]: If you leave valuables in your car it will tempt thieves.
example[3]: Iâ€™m tempted to buy that dress.
